page: ME60407: Finite Element Methods In Engineering

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Basic concepts: The standard discrete system, Finite elements of an elastic continuum-displacement approach, Generalization of the finite element conceptsweighted residual and variational approaches. Element types: triangular, rectangular, quadrilateral, sector, curved, isoparametric elements and numerical integration. Automatic mesh generation schemes. Application to structural mechanics problems: plane stress and plane strains, Axisymmetric stress analysis, three dimensional stress analysis, bending of plates. Introduction to the use of FEM in steady state field problems-heat conduction, fluid flow and non-linear material problems, plasticity, creep etc. Computer procedures for Finite element analysis.
page: ME60407: Finite Element Methods In Engineering

title: Student Opinion
text:
If taught by SG, just don't take it. He doesn't know FEM.
if any other good prof is teaching, can take the course. You learn the theory by FEM - what matrices are involved, what numerical methods are used and so on.
page: ME60407: Finite Element Methods In Engineering
